title: U.S., China move trade talks to Shanghai amid deal pessimism
text: U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators shift to Shanghai this week for their first in-person talks since a G20 truce last month, a change of scenery for two sides struggling to resolve deep differences on how to end a year-long trade war.

title: Oil prices slip after 'constructive' talks on Iran's nuclear deal
text: Oil prices fell on Monday after Iran described emergency talks on a multi-party nuclear agreement with a group of signatories as "constructive", suggesting an easing of tensions in the Middle East.

title: Former Fed Chair Janet Yellen says she's in favor of an interest rate cut
text: Former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen said she supports a 25-basis-point cut in the U.S. benchmark interest rate due to a weaker global economy.

title: Asian shares drift into trade talks, Fed test
text: Asian shares drifted lower on Monday as markets anxiously counted down to a likely cut in U.S. interest rates this week with much riding on whether or not the Federal Reserve signals yet more are in the pipeline.

title: Asia stocks mostly slip with US-China trade talks set to resume this week
text: Stocks in Asia mostly slipped in Monday morning trade as U.S.-China negotiations resume in Beijing later this week amid low expectations for a major breakthrough.

title: Wall Street bull expects the record rally to temporarily get tripped up
text: Oppenheimer Asset Management's John Stoltzfus expects wave of volatility to pressure stocks due to uncertainty.

title: Fed Poised to Cut Rates for First Time Since Financial Crisis, Ending an Era
text: Investors expect a quarter-point precautionary cut, a turning point that underlines that this might be as good as the economy will get.

title: A Recession Is Coming (Eventually). Here’s Where You’ll See It First.
text: Economists don’t know when the decade-long expansion, now the longest in American history, will end. But here are the indicators they will be watching to figure it out.

title: There are Signs Stocks are Running Out of Steam
text: The S&P 500 Index says bull market. But other major indexes say otherwise.

title: The Week Ahead: Are Investors Really Too Bullish?
text: With the major averages at new highs some analysts are worried that investors are complacent or too bullish ahead of the FOMC meeting. A review of some key sentiment numbers along with the latest mutual fund flow data has Tom Aspray wondering if investor are really that bullish.

title: IPO Outlook For The Week: Cannabis, Cancer Therapy, Sushi And Holographic AR
text: For a more comprehensive IPO calendar, check out the offering in Benzinga Cloud. The IPO dates below are expected but not confirmed.

title: The stock market could be in for a 'VIXplosion,' says widely followed strategist Sven Henrich
text: With stocks on the rise, a key Fed meeting approaching and the lowest-volume month of the year coming up, the market's fear gauge could be about to spike, says NorthmanTrader strategist Sven Henrich.

title: AMD, GE, GM, Qualcomm, Square and More Major Earnings Coming This Week
text: Though we are well into the second-quarter earnings reporting season, many major companies have yet to share their results.

title: Apple, Chevron, Exxon, Pfizer, Verizon and More Dow Earnings This Week
text: Seven of the 30 Dow Jones industrial average components are scheduled to report their latest quarterly reports this week.

title: Passive investing boom could cause a market bubble, but not in the stocks you would expect
text: Real estate and utilities are the two sectors that have benefited the most from the rise of passive investing vehicles.

title: A Stark Prediction For The Future Of Bitcoin, ETH, XRP, And LTC
text: Bitcoin, ETH, XRP, And LTC will either die on their own or be killed by the ‘Establishment’

title: DOJ’s tech probe needs to be mindful of corporate harassment
text: The Department of Justice last week launched a wide-ranging antitrust review to determine if the largest technology companies are, or have been, stifling competition. The four that are reported to be most focused on — Facebook, Amazon, Apple and Google — account for almost a million high-paying jobs with good benefits, and are massive contributors.
